instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pbus voltage is low 1.6
threads.message:
Hey guys working on this 15 in retina which looks like it was sodomized by another shop. I noticed that pbus voltage was 1.6v at charger phase at <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, I checked my current sense resistors all seem good with normal readings 5v is at input pins of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> ac in is at normal 4v at pin 3 dc in is normal at pin 2. Checked ugate and Lgate with the oscilloscope buck controller is dead no cycling what else am i missing here? Where else can i check also no short to ground i checked for that too also <SIGNAL>SMC_REST_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v. is that supposed to be high?
I did replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> same results.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pbus voltage is low 1.6
threads.message: ACOK present? 3V42 present? Resistance to GND on PPBUS?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pbus voltage is low 1.6
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 27210"]ACOK present? 3V42 present? Resistance to GND on PPBUS?[/QUOTE]

PP3V42   3.419V
ACOK      3.268V
PPBUS Resistance to GND    OL

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pbus voltage is low 1.6
threads.message: Bad ISL or soldering or traces/sense resistors. If ACOK is present then you can just inject 12.6V onto PPBUS and the machine should power on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pbus voltage is low 1.6
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 27222"]Bad ISL or soldering or traces/sense resistors. If ACOK is present then you can just inject 12.6V onto PPBUS and the machine should power on.[/QUOTE]
Ok Duke mark this one as solved, you were right again current sense was the problem. Tho it it was not the resistor was at fault but the fucking test probe point on one of the traces for <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> was completely missing ran a jumper and is now back to normal again thanks for the advice again you really know your shit.
